title: [Large-Scale] Enhancing Mathematical Perception Through Linguistic Categorization: Short-Intensive Microlearning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical classification concepts (e.g., shape/number classification)
context.additional_context: Math concept categorization training combining linguistic labeling and semantic knowledge in a smartphone-based learning environment

learning_goals: Learners can classify geometric shapes with 90% accuracy using linguistic labels (e.g., "triangle," "rectangle")
Learners can reduce categorization judgment time by 20% by linking shape attributes (side length, angles) to semantic knowledge
Learners can improve the speed of discovering target shapes in visual search tasks by 15% by applying linguistic categorization.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
